Redhibition.definition: the rescission of the sale of or a reduction in the purchase price of a thing that has a redhibitory defect ;also
Redhibition.origin: [French rédhibition , from Latin redhibitio return of defective goods to the seller, from redhibēre to return (defective goods), from red- back + habēre to hold, have]

1.1: the rescission of the sale of or a reduction in the purchase price of a thing that has a redhibitory defect

2.1: the action for such a rescission or reduction
